name: 'King of the Hill' - The Souphanousinphones Quiz | Television | 10 Questions
tags: 'King Of The Hill' - Characters and Actors

questions.text: The Souphanousinphones live right next door to the Hills in 'King of the Hill', but they haven't always lived there.  What is the home country of both Kahn and his wife Minh?
questions.explanation:
Laos.

	Laos, a small landlocked country between Thailand and Vietnam (or so Kahn puts it), is the home country of both Kahn and his wife.  Kahn is very proud, perhaps overly proud, of his Laotian background, and he constantly juxtaposes himself against the 'rednecks' that live all around him.

questions.text: Is Texas the first state in the United States that the Souphanousinphones have called home?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Before they moved to Arlen, Kahn and his family resided in Orange County, California.  In fact, Anaheim, within Orange County, is the birthplace of Connie.  The fact that Kahn and his family come from California is additional fact that he uses to separate himself and the 'rednecks' in his mind.

questions.text: The same voice actor who plays Dale Gribble also provides the voice for Kahn.
questions.explanation:
False.

	While Dale Gribble is humorously voiced by Johnny Hardwick, Kahn is voiced with equal amusement by actor Toby Huss.  Oddly enough, Toby Huss also voices Cotton Hill, perhaps the polar opposite of Kahn in every respect.

questions.text: The same actress provides the voices for both Minh and her daughter Connie on 'King of the Hill'.
questions.explanation:
True.

	This may come as a surprise to some people, because the voices and expressions of Minh and Connie seem quite different, but this just validates the skill of Lauren Tom, a Chinese-American actress who obviously draws on her roots in her voice renditions of this mother-daughter pair.  Lauren Tom has appeared in numerous movie and television roles.  Perhaps who two most notable performances were in the movies 'The Joy Luck Club' and 'Bad Santa'.

questions.text: In one episode, Kahn's mother Laoma appeared, and became romantic with another character on the show, much to her son's horror.  Who was Laoma Souphanousinphone's brief amour?
questions.explanation:
Bill.

	Though Laoma is quite a number of years older than Bill, this did not stop the two of them from sharing a brief fling.  Laoma falls for the lonely Bill when she works as a housekeeper in his bachelor pad.  Kahn is simply appalled at the whole situation, not only by the love affair but also by the fact that his mother is working in 'that filthy cracker shack', or so he refers to Bill's home.

questions.text: Kahn drives a Chevy Tahoe.  What does Kahn's amusing license plate read?
questions.explanation:
KINGKAHN.

	Kahn has had several cars, including a Toyota van, a Nissan Maxima and a Chevy El Camino and a Chevy Tahoe.  In one episode, Bill runs over Kahn's vehicle with a tank he stole from the nearby army base.

questions.text: Though Minh and Peggy Hill are generally friendly to each other, they are also rivals.  Minh especially enjoys critiquing Peggy Hill's cooking.  What spice does she suggest needs to be added to Peggy's dishes?
questions.explanation:
Nutmeg.

	In one episode, Peggy is particularly humiliated by Minh when Minh tastes Peggy's famous Brown Betty (a baked pudding made with apples), and makes it better by adding a bit of flavor (namely, nutmeg).

questions.text: When Minh gets annoyed at Kahn, she sometimes refers to her father, a man who never seemed to approve of her marriage to Kahn.  What position did Minh's father hold in their native country?
questions.explanation:
General.

	Minh refers to her father, a general in the Laotian army, on certain occasions.  Apparently, her relationship with Kahn was never approved of, as Kahn was a 'rebellious' type.  They were forced to escape Laos, with Kahn using a car with official government license plates to flee to Thailand.

questions.text: Connie, aka Khan Jr., is a very intelligent and talented young girl.  At what musical instrument does she especially excel?
questions.explanation:
Violin.

	Unlike her on-again, off-again boyfriend Bobby Hill, Connie is a straight-A student in school, and is very focused on her academic future.  She is excellent on the violin, usually playing classical pieces, but occasionally delving into bluegrass.

questions.text: Connie has been Bobby's girlfriend several times, the two of them having broken up on numerous occasions.  In one episode, Bobby is attracted to Connie's visiting cousin, making her feel rather jealous.  What is Connie's cousin named?
questions.explanation:
Tid Pao.

	Tid Pao is a rebellious 'tagger' from California who comes to stay with Connie's family for a short time because she is having behavioral problems.  When Bobby sees Tid Pao, he exclaims (about her and Connie), 'That whole family is hot!' Thank you for playing this quiz, I hope you have enjoyed it!
